page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: OLD GWERNYFED COUNTRY MANOR WAS BUILT TOWARDS THE END OF THE 16TH CENTURY ON THE SITE OF AN OLDER DWELLING. IN 1633 IT WAS MODERNISED AND THE OWNERS EXTENDED THE ESTATE TO NEARLY 4000 ACRES, A PLACE OF GREAT LOCAL IMPORTANCE. IN 1780 A FIRE GUTTED THE SOUTH WING AND THE WOOD FAMILY WHO OWNED IT LEFT. UNTIL 1930 GWERNYFED WAS LEFT TO DETERIORATE AND USED AS A FARMHOUSE. THE FAMILY AGAIN INTERESTED THEMSELVES IN THE HOUSE AND USED IT AS A SUMMER HOUSE AFTER THEY HAD EVACUATED THEMSELVES HERE DURING THE WAR. IN 1964 THE BEETHAM FAMILY MOVED IN AND STARTED THE RENOVATION. IN 1970 THEY BEGAN TO TAKE IN 'BED & BREKFAST' CLIENTS. NOW IT HAS A FLOURISHING RESIDENTIAL TRADE WHERE PEOPLE CAM ENJOY A RESTFUL HOLIDAY IN THE BEAUTY OF THE BLACK MOUNTAINS.
